clustering_scheme.rationale: Organized into four tightly-coupled modules reflecting contributor progression, social learning (CoP), knowledge conversion (SECI), and community boundary processes to minimize cross-lines and support modular reasoning.

clusters.name: Contributor Progression Pipeline
clusters.theme: Stocks and flows governing movement from newcomer to core and exits.

clusters.name: Community Dynamics & Mentoring
clusters.theme: Social processes that enable legitimate peripheral participation, mentoring, and belonging.

clusters.name: Knowledge Creation & Management (SECI)
clusters.theme: Tacit/explicit knowledge stocks and conversion dynamics affecting learning and onboarding.

clusters.name: Onboarding & Boundary Processes
clusters.theme: Community boundary inflow and its determinants.

layout_hints: Place Contributor Progression Pipeline centrally since it connects most heavily to all clusters.
Position Community Dynamics & Mentoring to the right of the Pipeline to shorten mentoring-related links.
Place Knowledge Creation & Management to the left of the Pipeline; it connects to both Pipeline and Onboarding.
Put Onboarding & Boundary Processes below the Pipeline to minimize crossings from both Knowledge and Community clusters into Onboarding.

theories.name: Communities of Practice (Wenger)
theories.rationale: The model already captures movement from periphery to core and mentoring. CoP adds boundary processes (onboarding), capacity constraints (mentor availability), and identity/belonging that affect retention and progression. These additions operationalize legitimate peripheral participation and social support, improving fidelity of transitions and dropout dynamics.

variables.name: Potential Contributors (Observers/Users)
variables.description: People aware of or adjacent to the project who have not yet contributed.

variables.name: Onboarding Rate
variables.description: Rate at which potential contributors become New Contributors.

variables.name: Onboarding Experience Quality
variables.description: Perceived quality of first-contact experience; composite of mentorship, documentation, task clarity, and barriers.

variables.name: Core Developer Mentoring Capacity
variables.description: Effective mentoring bandwidth of core developers given workload and time.

variables.name: Mentor-to-Newcomer Ratio
variables.description: Ratio indicating sufficiency of mentors relative to newcomers; higher is better.

variables.name: Legitimate Peripheral Task Availability
variables.description: Availability and clarity of low-risk, beginner-friendly tasks (LPP).

variables.name: Sense of Belonging
variables.description: Degree to which contributors feel recognized and part of the community.

variables.name: Contribution Barriers
variables.description: Friction from tooling, governance, processes, or norms that hinder entry.

variables.name: Lapsed Contributors
variables.description: Contributors who have exited (from any level) into inactivity.

variables.name: New Contributor Dropout Rate
variables.description: Outflow of New Contributors into Lapsed Contributors.

variables.name: Experienced Contributor Turnover Rate
variables.description: Outflow of Experienced Contributors into Lapsed Contributors.
Renamed for clarity; represents people at the community boundary who may become contributors.
Clarifies that this flow drains the Core Developer stock.

theories.name: Nonaka's SECI Model
theories.rationale: Current variables nod to implicit and explicit transfer but lack knowledge stocks and conversion loops. Adding tacit/explicit stocks, conversion and decay rates, and enabling context (Ba) creates a SECI spiral that influences learning, onboarding, and retention. This tightens causal pathways from documentation and mentoring to progression rates.

variables.name: Project Tacit Knowledge
variables.description: Collective know-how embedded in practices and people.

variables.name: Project Explicit Knowledge
variables.description: Project documentation, guides, and knowledge bases.

variables.name: Externalization Rate
variables.description: Conversion of tacit knowledge into explicit artifacts.

variables.name: Tacit Knowledge Decay Rate
variables.description: Loss of tacit know-how due to forgetting, change, or turnover.

variables.name: Documentation Obsolescence Rate
variables.description: Rate at which explicit knowledge becomes outdated.

variables.name: Shared Context for Knowledge Creation (Ba)
variables.description: Quality of the shared space enabling socialization and externalization.

variables.name: Documentation Quality
variables.description: Accuracy, completeness, clarity, and findability of explicit knowledge.

variables.name: Internalization Effectiveness
variables.description: Effectiveness with which explicit knowledge is absorbed into practice.

variables.name: Documentation Accessibility
variables.description: Ease of discovering and navigating documentation.
